Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) The activity is a commercial product testing.
B) The activity is a routine medical procedure with no data collection.
C) The activity is a research study.
D) The activity is a recreational event for entertainment purposes.

Correct answer: C) The activity is a research study.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
Questions:
What is the primary objective of the ELEVATE study?
A) To evaluate the effectiveness of a new exercise program for women; B) To assess the acceptability of information sessions and self-testing in cervical cancer prevention; C) To develop a new vaccine for cervical cancer; D) To study the impact of dietary changes on cervical cancer risk
Correct answer: B

Topics: The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How much time is anticipated for your participation in the information session, including questionnaires and self-test, as part of the ELEVATE study?
A) 15-30 minutes; B) 30-60 minutes; C) 1-2 hours; D) 2-3 hours
Correct answer: B) 30-60 minutes

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs for participating in the ELEVATE study?
A) Participants will incur additional costs for the tests and procedures involved in the study.
B) Participants will be responsible for travel expenses related to the study.
C) There are no additional costs for participants, but they will receive financial compensation for their time.
D) Participation in the study does not involve any additional costs for the participants.

Correct answer: D) Participation in the study does not involve any additional costs for the participants.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What is the correct sequence of procedures a participant will undergo in the ELEVATE study on the acceptability of information sessions and self-testing in cervical cancer prevention?

A) Attend an information session, take a self-test, complete questionnaires, and participate in a follow-up phone interview.
B) Complete questionnaires, attend an information session, receive a follow-up phone call, and then take a self-test.
C) Take a self-test, attend an information session, receive educational materials, and then complete a follow-up questionnaire.
D) Receive a follow-up phone call, attend an information session, take a self-test, and then complete questionnaires.

Correct answer: A) Attend an information session, take a self-test, complete questionnaires, and participate in a follow-up phone interview.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the ELEVATE study at any point after consenting to participate?
A) You will be required to provide a reason for your withdrawal and may affect your future relationship with the researcher; B) You will not be able to access any medical treatment for injuries related to the study; C) You may withdraw at any time without giving a reason and it will not affect your relationship with the researcher or your future treatment; D) Your previously collected personal data will be deleted from the study database immediately upon your withdrawal.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following procedures in the ELEVATE study is considered experimental?
A) Attending regular cervical cancer screening with a gynecologist; B) Participating in an information session about cervical cancer prevention; C) Using a self-sampling test for HPV as part of the study; D) Completing a questionnaire about personal health history

Correct answer: C) Using a self-sampling test for HPV as part of the study

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many women are expected to participate in the ELEVATE study on the acceptability of information sessions and self-testing in cervical cancer prevention?
A) 500-600; B) 1100-1120; C) 250-260; D) 800-900
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks or discomforts mentioned in the consent form for participants of the ELEVATE study?
A) Risk of severe allergic reactions to the self-test materials; B) Risk of data breach due to inadequate data protection measures; C) Minor bleeding after taking the self-test; D) Risk of injury due to participation in focus group discussions
Correct answer: C

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes a potential benefit of participating in the ELEVATE study on the acceptability of information sessions and self-testing in cervical cancer prevention?

A) Participants will receive a financial incentive for their involvement in the study.
B) Participants will gain personal medical benefits from the cervical cancer screening.
C) Participants will contribute to research that may lead to more effective methods of encouraging cervical cancer screening.
D) Participants will be provided with a cure for cervical cancer if detected during the study.

Correct answer: C) Participants will contribute to research that may lead to more effective methods of encouraging cervical cancer screening.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What alternative options are available to you if you choose not to participate in the ELEVATE study on the acceptability of information sessions and self-testing in cervical cancer prevention?
A) You can participate in a different study focused on cervical cancer prevention; B) You can have yourself screened for cervical cancer by your GP or gynaecologist; C) There are no alternative options available; D) You will be provided with a home-based cervical cancer screening kit.
Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you suffer an injury as a result of participating in the ELEVATE study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation and medical treatment?
A) You will receive financial compensation for the injury regardless of its cause.
B) The sponsor has taken out insurance that will provide compensation and/or medical treatment for injuries related to the study.
C) You will be responsible for all medical costs associated with any injuries sustained during the study.
D) No compensation or medical treatment is available in the event of an injury.

Correct answer: B) The sponsor has taken out insurance that will provide compensation and/or medical treatment for injuries related to the study.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a result of participating in the ELEVATE study, whom should you contact for assistance?
A) The Data Protection Officer; B) The Belgian supervisory authority; C) Prof. O. Degomme, the principal investigator; D) Your personal physician
Correct answer: C) Prof. O. Degomme, the principal investigator

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form state about your right to withdraw from the study?

A) You may withdraw at any time, but it may affect your future medical care.
B) You may withdraw at any time, and it will result in a penalty or loss of benefits.
C) You may withdraw at any time without giving a reason, and it will not affect your relationship with the investigator or your entitlement to benefits.
D) You cannot withdraw once you have agreed to participate in the study.

Correct answer: C) You may withdraw at any time without giving a reason, and it will not affect your relationship with the investigator or your entitlement to benefits.
